I think Dead by Daylight is a good game, I think there is room for improvement, but that can be said for all games. The core mechanics are good and there is normally a good balance between the Killer and the Survivors, although again, there could always be room for improvement. All in all I would recommend this game to anyone looking for a good horror/survival to play with or without friends.
This game is hard to start off with but is bloody amazing and addictive!!

The map meet factory is too difficult for human.

the game could be fun if everyone wasnt so tryhard and win at any cost and instead cared more about having fun, but what do you expect with a game that forces you to play in ranked or make no genuine "progression". by progression i mean earn bloodpoints so you can get more perks and consumeables to level up to, you guessed it, earn bloodpoints so you can get more perks and consumeables and to level up. the variety of map, for the most part, is the same half dozen maps generated differently over and over with the major set pieces being different, the exception being the maps made for specific killer/survivor pairings that come out with a single map being made as a set for them. 
the game would be a lot more fun if the pointless irrelevant rank system didnt exist or there were other game modes or objectives. as a survivor all you do is repair generators, open gates, escape, or die. as a killer you just kill the survivors. 

with the extreme lack of game modes, repetetiveness, and underhandedness of the devs who listen to moderately popular and dbd focused twitch streamers that report people directly to the devs, then the devs put a ban on another player that not only did not deserve that ban at all in the first place, but if the person had never been banned before, the dev would give them an escelated ban one step away from a perma ban, for something the person didnt even do or say, that the streamer exagerated or even outright lied about, but the devs dont care and take streamers word for it anyways. for all this i cannot reccomend the game. 

also maybe the devs should be consistant on the rules or even post them in the first place instead of one dev saying something in an interview that conflicts with what another dev says on twitter and other media and not correcting one another it would be easier to make sense of things when it comes to the rules. leaving them intentionally vague and some even conflicting it is almost as if they just want grey area to justify any bannings they do which is really shitty of them.

this review is coming from someone that owns the game, all killers, all survivors, and the soundtrack, across multiple platforms. 

EDIT: recently they added back the penalty for quitting games. people who legit lose power or internet are also penalized as quitting by the way. i get modders and hackers who speed hack, ignore cooldowns on abilities like dead hard and sprint burst and so on and im not going to continue a match with cheaters so regardless of the devs stupid decision to punish people for quitting, i will quit and take the punishment because i REFUSE to finish and match which rewards cheaters and shitty toxic players so i will just have to get penalized for refusing to play against cheaters. thanks devs for yet another stupid decision!
If you get angry easily dont play this game.
I must say, you guys did a pretty good job so far! uwu

After playing this game for a while now, I must say, that I highly recommend this game to everyone, who liked and used to play hide and seek in his childhood. 

Pros: If you're as desperate to die as I am, you will succeed eventually.

Whether you like to play as a killer or a survivor, this game allows you to develop your own unique playstyle.
Due to the great variety of maps, perks, survivors, killers, items and addons, you're forced to perennially adapt to new group constellations and killers faced out in the fog. This game allows you to add your own little touch to a specific killer or survivor. You either choose to adapt to your groups playstyle and stick together or you try to survive on your own.

Dead by Daylight provides great game mechanics. It changes from movement to stealth in a way I never expected.  
Its compelling, interesting and also original in it's own way. 
Its exhilarating being chased as a survivor, but simultaneously a lot of fun running around to stalk, torture and kill them.

Also a huge thumbs up for the fact, that you're not forced to talk to others. No doubt it might be usefull and come in handy. In reality, you'd just listen to an eleven or twelve year-old bragging or raging about literally nothing.
Dbd does not provide a mic system, kudos to that.
The only way you're able to communicate with your fellow survivors is before a match begins. After a game has ended, the post-game chat is the only way you can talk to the killer. 

All in all, I really love this game. It's up to you as a survivor, whether or not you're going for that save or you're just going to continue and mind your own business. As a killer, it's basically up to you, who or what you are going for. Just don't be a dick and do not camp after you successfully hooked someone.

[b] 10/10 would buy again. [/b]

I voted this down but I still think it's a good buy IF you can get into some quick fun without putting too much thought into it.

This game is an absolute balance mess. You'd  think a game about surviving supernatural killers would be about trying to actualy survive but no... once you get into decent gear as survivors, it's all just about cat and mouse - survivors baiting, kiting, looping killers like idiots and throw the whole survival concept out the window. There is only one way to play this game if you're even slightly competitive - being good either at running or at chasing. No stealth play, no strategic planing, nothing, just chase and run.  Unfortunately, this also means >80% of perks, add-ons, surviors and killers are useless at any slightly competitibe plays unless you want to torment yourself. 

Most killers are also very badly designed. Well, that's not entirely accurate. Most of them are designed for gameplay styles that don't actually exist. Again, it all comes down to being good at chasing and running. And whichever characters or gears you choose that don't fit narrative, you're just gonna end up in matches after matches of agony. 

The perks and add-on system (equivalent to gearing system) is also badly designed, especially on the killer part. For survivors, it's understandable because there aren't much thematic differences between theme. A black dude can run just as good as an asian chick and that makes sense. But for killers, they are supposed to be unique, to have style and iconic tactic and they have anything but. You can play any killers, it won't really matter because to be effective you will be forced to use NOED, Blood warden, bla bla all of which have nothing to do whatsoever with the killers' power. It's just survivors vs, perks most of the time. >90% of the perks are also garbages for the killers they come with... like... wtf is that? For example, myer is a stealth killer, and to augment that, you need trait from doctor. Some may say it's designed so that you play every killer but I call that bullshit and a waste of time. Also, perks are the end all be all rather than the actual killers' powers which are supposed to be the main thin. This makes sense on survivors because they don't have unique powers but it's absolutely stupid concept on killers. It makes choosing killers pointless and puts way way more focus on perks. 

Killers among themelves are also badly balanced. Some killers are so reliant on add-ons that they are entirely useless without them. Some killers absolutely wreck people with zero add-ons. Like, you gotta pick one way or another, either make add-ons just QoL, minor bonus or make builds actually rely on them. The current system creates so much disparity of performance among killers, it's stupid. 

The game is also a heaven for bad-mannering. It's just that the system fully allows those behaviors to exist - teabagging, flashlight flickering, disconnect on purpose when about to lose etc. Not to mention stupid design oversight that allows things like body-blocking in the game. Like, hello, this bitch is literally blocking my 8 foot tall killer from the door, so much immersion. So, if you're going to play, prepare for a lot of toxicity and unpleasant experience. 

This game is like AOL of the internet. It's the only one worth playing of its genre, and the moment something else slightly better comes out, it's gonna get wrecked.

Beaucoup de bug, le jeux a un avenir prometteur mais je crois que les developpeurs en ont un peu rien a foutre. J'ai perdu 4 rank enormement de points pour aucune raison, je ne souhaite pas un retour, mais j'aimerais que vous regler au moins ce bug.

You just get Camped  and i want a refund on this shitty ass game

Pros

Exciting
Fun to play with friends
Variety of perks, characters, items allow for different playstyles
Each match is different


Cons
Once you get to the green ranks every match has a friends group in it
Survivors tend to get really salty if you're playing killer and trying to win
Survivors get toxic if you're playing killer and don't do well
No limits on items so survivors can run 4 toolboxes or 4 flashlights and gen rush or make your life hell
With big updates the servers tend to go down but hasn't happened that often for me personally

All in all I still find the game enjoyable and would recommend it
